body:
### Describe the bug

Currently, the interfaces of compiled generator iterators, coroutine objects, and asynchronous generator iterators differ from those provided and expected by CPython. Specifically, the following attributes (read-only properties) are missing (see https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/20522#issuecomment-3708510074):

* `GeneratorType.gi_suspended` (Python ≥3.11, python/cpython#30633)
* `CoroutineType.cr_suspended` (Python ≥3.11, python/cpython#30633)
* `CoroutineType.cr_origin` (Python ≥3.7, python/cpython#5250)
* `AsyncGeneratorType.ag_code` (Python ≥3.6, PEP 525)
* `AsyncGeneratorType.ag_frame` (Python ≥3.6, PEP 525)
* `AsyncGeneratorType.ag_suspended` (Python ≥3.12, python/cpython#11590)

As a result, the [`inspect.getgeneratorstate()`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getgeneratorstate), [`inspect.getcoroutinestate()`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getcoroutinestate), and [`inspect.getasyncgenstate()`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getasyncgenstate) functions do not work for compiled objects (they raise `AttributeError` for any state other than `*_RUNNING`), since starting with 3.11 they rely on the `*_suspended` attributes (previously they relied on `*_frame.f_lasti`, but its initial value has been changed).

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import asyncio
import inspect
import sys

from types import coroutine


def generator_function():
    yield (yield)()


@coroutine  # in-place
def coroutine_function_impl():
    yield from generator_function()


async def coroutine_function():
    await coroutine_function_impl()


async def async_generator_function():
    yield (yield)()


async def main():
    gen = generator_function()
    print(inspect.getgeneratorstate(gen))
    gen.send(None)
    print(inspect.getgeneratorstate(gen))
    print(gen.send(lambda: inspect.getgeneratorstate(gen)))
    print(inspect.getgeneratorstate(gen))
    gen.close()
    print(inspect.getgeneratorstate(gen))

    coro = coroutine_function()
    print(inspect.getcoroutinestate(coro))
    coro.send(None)
    print(inspect.getcoroutinestate(coro))
    print(coro.send(lambda: inspect.getcoroutinestate(coro)))
    print(inspect.getcoroutinestate(coro))
    coro.close()
    print(inspect.getcoroutinestate(coro))

    if sys.version_info >= (3, 12):
        agen = async_generator_function()
        print(inspect.getasyncgenstate(agen))
        await agen.asend(None)
        print(inspect.getasyncgenstate(agen))
        print(await agen.asend(lambda: inspect.getasyncgenstate(agen)))
        print(inspect.getasyncgenstate(agen))
        await agen.aclose()
        print(inspect.getasyncgenstate(agen))


if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main())

```


### Expected behaviour

```
GEN_CREATED
GEN_SUSPENDED
GEN_RUNNING
GEN_SUSPENDED
GEN_CLOSED
CORO_CREATED
CORO_SUSPENDED
CORO_RUNNING
CORO_SUSPENDED
CORO_CLOSED
AGEN_CREATED
AGEN_SUSPENDED
AGEN_RUNNING
AGEN_SUSPENDED
AGEN_CLOSED
```

### OS

Linux

### Python version

≥3.11

### Cython version

3.2.4

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] `inspect.get*state()` does not work for compiled objects on Python ≥3.11
